update.description:
* Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch [generalize_actor](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/generalize_actor%0Ddefault#diff) I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was `required="1"` into `required="0"`

* Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is `__default__` instead of checking that `sdf->HasElement`.

* Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.
update.title: Document actor, make skin and animation optional

content.raw: Removed the physics engine and also the reference to specific file formats. What do you think about deprecating `static` then? Should we leave it there in case we need it in the future?
content.html: Removed the physics engine and also the reference to specific file formats. What do you think about deprecating static then? Should we leave it there in case we need it in the future?

content.raw: We should leave out "ignoring the physics engine". That phrase is Gazebo specific, and might/will change in the future.

content.raw: the `static` element is not used at all right? It's just here so that Models can load properly? Maybe we can deprecate this and remove it in sdf 1.7?
content.html: the static element is not used at all right? It's just here so that Models can load properly? Maybe we can deprecate this and remove it in sdf 1.7?
